channel.title: Random Number Changes in Loop Help

item.title: Random Number Changes in Loop Help
item.dc:creator: @wildskiller wildskiller
item.description:
@wildskiller wrote:

I’m guessing your on dementhium. You should look at the methods in ObjectManager.java, those should make it local for everyone. You don’t need the for loop, that is most likely why it’s showing differently for everyone else.

Read full topic
item.source: Random Number Changes in Loop Help

item.title: Random Number Changes in Loop Help
item.dc:creator: @sageofmali sageofmali
item.description:
@sageofmali wrote:

Okay, I lost some of my files, so I’m trying to figure out how I made this work right. So every time you use this item, it spawns a different object for each person who sees it.

public static int flowers[] = {2980, 2981, 2982, 2983, 2984, 2985, 2986, 2987, 2988}; public static int flowers() { return flowers[(int) (Math.random() * flowers.length)]; }
and I have the code written similar to this:[code=java]

	for (Player p : World.getWorld().getPlayers()) {
		p.getActionSender().sendCreateObject(flowers(), getLocation().getZ(), getLocation().getX(), getLocation().getY(), 0, 10);
	}[/code]

I don’t see why it won’t show the same for everyone, please help.

Read full topic
item.source: Random Number Changes in Loop Help
